crazyballrun.game.gui

Class GUIControl

  • java.lang.Object
    • crazyballrun.game.gui.GUIControl
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CBButton, CBFrame, CBLevelDescription, CBListBox, CBLoadImage, CBTextBox

    public abstract class GUIControl
extends java.lang.Object
    The abstract class GUIControl provides basic functionality for GUI controls and an interface for the implementation of GUI-elements.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected boolean mDoubleFont
      Paint the font with some shadow-background.
      protected java.awt.Color mFontColor
      Font color of the text.
      protected java.lang.String mImageName
      Root filename of the image (without "_[x]_[y].png"-file-ending).
      protected boolean mIsActive
      Defines if the control is visible/active or not.
      protected GUIFrame mMyFrame
      Reference to the GUIFrame containing the GUIControl.
      protected int[] mRectangle
      This explicitly stores the absolute position and size data of the GUIControl on the screen (in pixels). mRectangle[0/1] is the x/y- coordinate of the position of the left+top corner of the control, mRectangle[2/3] the x/y-coordinate of the right+bottom corner of the control. mRectangle[4/5] is the width/height in pixels.
      protected java.awt.Font mTitleFont
      Font to use for rendering the control's text.
      protected static int sElementPixelSize
      Local copy of "GUIElementPixelSize" (-> GameSettings).

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GUIControl()

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void activate()
      Activates the GUIControl.
      void create(java.lang.String id, GUIFrame frame, double x1, double y1, double x2, double y2)
      Creates the GUIControl from given input.
      void deactivate()
      Deactivates the GUIControl.
      protected int getHeight()
      Gets the height of the control in "GUIElementPixelSize" (-> GameSettings).
      java.lang.String getId()
      Gets the unique string identifier of the control.
      protected int getWidth()
      Gets the width of the control in "GUIElementPixelSize" (-> GameSettings).
      abstract void initialize()
      After finishing the creation of a gui control this method is called to finish control specific initilization of the GUIControl implementation.
      abstract void paint(java.awt.Graphics g, java.awt.Frame frame)
      Paints the control to the specified Graphics-reference.
      abstract void setAttribute(java.lang.String attr, java.lang.String value)
      Sets an attribute to the specified value.
      protected void setColor(java.lang.String r, java.lang.String g, java.lang.String b)
      Sets the font color to the specified rgb-value.
      protected void setFont(java.lang.String font)
      Sets the font of the title.

    • Field Detail

      • sElementPixelSize

        protected static int sElementPixelSize
        Local copy of "GUIElementPixelSize" (-> GameSettings).

      • mTitleFont

        protected java.awt.Font mTitleFont
        Font to use for rendering the control's text.

      • mFontColor

        protected java.awt.Color mFontColor
        Font color of the text.

      • mDoubleFont

        protected boolean mDoubleFont
        Paint the font with some shadow-background.

      • mRectangle

        protected int[] mRectangle
        This explicitly stores the absolute position and size data of the GUIControl on the screen (in pixels). mRectangle[0/1] is the x/y- coordinate of the position of the left+top corner of the control, mRectangle[2/3] the x/y-coordinate of the right+bottom corner of the control. mRectangle[4/5] is the width/height in pixels.

      • mImageName

        protected java.lang.String mImageName
        Root filename of the image (without "_[x]_[y].png"-file-ending).

      • mIsActive

        protected boolean mIsActive
        Defines if the control is visible/active or not.

      • mMyFrame

        protected GUIFrame mMyFrame
        Reference to the GUIFrame containing the GUIControl.

    • Method Detail

      • setColor

        protected void setColor(java.lang.String r,
            java.lang.String g,
            java.lang.String b)
        Sets the font color to the specified rgb-value.
        Parameters:
        r - red color (0-255)
        g - green color (0-255)
        b - blue color (0-255)

      • setFont

        protected void setFont(java.lang.String font)
        Sets the font of the title.
        Parameters:
        font - string representation of the font: [fontname],[fontsize] [,optional:font attribute]

      • create

        public final void create(java.lang.String id,
          GUIFrame frame,
          double x1,
          double y1,
          double x2,
          double y2)
        Creates the GUIControl from given input.
        Parameters:
        id - identifier of the control
        frame - corresponding reference to the frame
        x1 - x-coordinate of the left/top corner (between 0 and 1, resolution independent)
        y1 - y-coordinate of the left/top corner (between 0 and 1, resolution independent)
        x2 - x-coordinate of the right/bottom corner (between 0 and 1, resolution independent)
        y2 - y-coordinate of the right/bottom corner (between 0 and 1, resolution independent)

      • getHeight

        protected int getHeight()
        Gets the height of the control in "GUIElementPixelSize" (-> GameSettings).
        Returns:
        the height of the control.

      • getWidth

        protected int getWidth()
        Gets the width of the control in "GUIElementPixelSize" (-> GameSettings).
        Returns:
        the width of the control.

      • getId

        public final java.lang.String getId()
        Gets the unique string identifier of the control.
        Returns:
        the control's id.

      • setAttribute

        public abstract void setAttribute(java.lang.String attr,
                java.lang.String value)
        Sets an attribute to the specified value.
        Parameters:
        attr - name of the attribute
        value - value for the attribute

      • initialize

        public abstract void initialize()
        After finishing the creation of a gui control this method is called to finish control specific initilization of the GUIControl implementation.

      • activate

        public void activate()
        Activates the GUIControl.

      • deactivate

        public void deactivate()
        Deactivates the GUIControl.

      • paint

        public abstract void paint(java.awt.Graphics g,
         java.awt.Frame frame)
        Paints the control to the specified Graphics-reference.
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics-reference for rendering
        frame - Frame-reference where to paint the control
